description: A central hub built for social media influencers that are looking to increase their exposure to the public, track and calculate engagement rates to strategically cater their content to their demographic audience, and mint their social media posts as NFTs to avoid payola if their content is affiliated with a brand or company
note: Internship project currently under development. Source code cannot be revealed due to a signed NDA with the company (Social PayMe). Live link will be displayed once production build is deployed, and technology stack will be disclosed during an interview process

description: A tool that streamlines the process of taking attendance through the use of QR codes. This application is developed for an organization hosting large events with the requirement of taking attendance quickly and reliably. To use this application, the organization and attendee must preferrably have a mobile phone. The attendee shows their QR code in where the application scans the QR code that registers the attendee in the Firebase database.
note: If testing out live code, I recommend having two seperate devices. One to scan QR code and one to generate the QR code. 'test' is the id for both attendee and volunteer user for demonstration purposes. See video for more information

description: A MERN application built for the BeachHacks organization that tracks the popularity of events and workshops hosted by the organization. The data is used by the data analyis team to make improvements to future events and workshops
note: Repository has been archived and API endpoints has been removed, but front-end is still available.
